I downloaded it and installed it, but couldn't run it. It gave me the "Send=
/Don't Send" error message and that was it. I have all other components ins=
talled, like the XNA. I have an AMD Athlon64 x2 machine with 1 GB or RAM an=
d an Nvidia GeForce 8600 GTS video card. Please tell me if you need more in=
fo to resolve the problem. Did you had other such reports except mine? Perh=
aps I have a poorly configured machine.  

Peter

--- In neat@yahoogroups.c=
om, "Kenneth Stanley" <kstanley@...> wrote:
>
> I am pleased to announce th=
at GAR is now released and available at:
> 
> http://gar.eecs.ucf.edu
> 
> =
As some of you know, GAR can be played single player or multiplayer online.=
  In the multiplayer mode, the evolution of CPPN-controlled weapons in the =
game is influenced by all the players online, making it (as far as I know) =
the first example of real online content evolution in a multiplayer game.  =
The algorithm is called cgNEAT, for content-generating NEAT.
> 
> Both game=
 client and online server (for hosting your own galaxy) are available.  We =
are also hosting an official GAR server with high capacity because of our f=
ast connection at UCF.
> 
> This project was very complex, in effect involv=
ing the implementation of not just a game, but an online service and a nove=
l evolutionary algorithm, so there could be a few unanticipated hiccups in =
the first release, but I think you will find it entertaining and interestin=
g.
> 
> ken
>
